Reviews.Title: “Good affordable option - not if you can't stand smoking”
Reviews.Author: jurcsi
Reviews.Content: Most of pro's and con's are already stated, I have to mostly agree with them. Pro: - easy to find - free parking - free shuttle bus to centre - good size room Cons: - only very few non-smoking room, of course when asked for non smoking they said it is fully booked. (maybe it was on the first night, but for sure not on the 2 other days) - no fridge in the room - no internet in the room - only one chair in a double room I think it is very expensive, but everything looks like very expensive in Key West, so be prepared for that. The room was ok (clean and good sized), but smelled from cigarette (it was a smoking room) and had no fridge. As we did not had one on the road side, but looking to the small garden it was actually quite nice, and no issues with sound whatsoever. It is not very close to the centre, but you can take the free bus service, or you can hire a bicycle/scooter. Even on a bicycle you can reach the city in 20 mins. The Waffle House right at the hotel was packed every morning, but actually I had the worst experience with staff there for the whole holiday. You can find much better places to have a meal or breakfast in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Easy to find, affordable but dated”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay C
Reviews.Content: This is just about the first hotel you come to when you reach Key West, but that also means it is farthest from Mallory Square, Duval, etc... I didn't find it to be a problem, as a bus pass is included for each day of your stay for each guest to get you there and back. The bus ran every 15 minutes till 11pm. At almost $200 a night, it is cheap for Key West, the rooms are clean but well used and outdated. Due to its lower price, it is popular with the younger crowd (ie- Spring Breakers).

Reviews.Title: “Noisy.....”
Reviews.Author: bigblock1970
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the road side(mistake)make sure your room is not on the roadside.Our room was very noisy,the door didn't shut properly,and the Harley's idling in the parking lot at 2 in the morning didn't help.breakfast in the morning was ok.all in all we paid over 200 for the night,for a lousy sleep,not too impressed

Reviews.Title: “A low cost alternative”
Reviews.Author: EDF1958
Reviews.Content: If you want to call $140 low cost, but in Key West it is. We'll usually do a one night stay, and I can stay about anywhere for one night. It has a pretty good location, right as you enter the island, and entry is easy and parking is no problem. For a longer stay I would probably pick somewhere nicer, but it is OK for what it is. Don't expect luxury, just a decent place to stay. We were upgraded to a suite last time and it was huge.

Reviews.Title: “Key West visit”
Reviews.Author: Jim T
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West last week and stayed here. Clean room, comfortable bed, nice staff, cheap price. My kind of place. We will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “great service”
Reviews.Author: sheilalacon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January for a family wedding on the beach. Whilst it was a basic motel it was well managed and very friendly and helpful staff. We had a problem with a bath plug at 11.00pm one night the maintenance man was very quick to come and repair it. He ended up getting a replacement part, all with a cheerful smile. This hotel gave great service without the constant hand out for a tip that seems to be so prevalent in many places in the States. The staff went out of their way to help us with all the extra demands we made on them. We had occupied 7 rooms in all. They made our stay very much more relaxed and pleasant. The location is also convenient and easy to reach the attractions. We even walked to some!

Reviews.Title: “Do not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Belle631
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be torn down and a new one built, the rooms were smelly from smoke, it is old and run down, carpets have stains, doors hanging from sink cabinets, tile cracked, drapes not closeable due to broken hooks, rowdy late crowd making lots of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: KCsofl
Reviews.Content: Carpet was black, was supposed to be a tan color, beds seem like they are 20 years old, comforters had yellow and red stains, so room was horrible, but very nice and friendly staff, not enough to offset the quality of room. Maybe if they cleaned the carpet and had better beds, I would reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Patty, the asst gm is amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Elyse F
Reviews.Content: If Patty is not offered a lofty position in the company, then there will be a major oversight. She's outstanding in all facets, and single-handedly made our experience very good. She's the type of agent any organization would envy, and I was very pleased to work with her. Please call me directly with any thoughts or questions on my submission! Jon Monahan ------------

Reviews.Title: “If you just need a crash pad!”
Reviews.Author: TGAC
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Key West during their high season, you probably already know that EVERY hotel is expensive. We booked the Days Inn through Hotwire, and still paid $160 for this motel. Here's the thing...Lysol makes this great product, "Lysol To Go" -- use it here. The carpet had stains and the bathroom could use a gallon of bleach, but it is inexpensive, especially if you just need somewhere to sleep off your margaritas! Speaking of margaritas...check out this property on a map. It is on the most north/east end of Key West, just as you cross on to the island. If you plan to party on Duval, cabs will cost you about $15-$20 before tip (PLEASE don't drink and drive!!!). However, being on this end means you are close to Smathers Beach, which is lovely. The Waffle House is your option for breakfast. You may have to wait for a table, but their service is FAST, so you won't wait long. Also, there's coffee and juice available in the Lobby, where you will also find VERY FRIENDLY staff. We did not take a dip in the pool, but did check it out. It seemed nice and clean. It was near the ice machine that was the worst part of the motel--it took forever to literally procure 10 ice cubes...but I think we'll get over that :)

Reviews.Title: “Good quality for the price...”
Reviews.Author: VolkerS2
Reviews.Content: .... but the motel needs improvements. For one: the rooms are really spacious, but there is only one very small round table, not really a table, just something very low to put a big plate on. And there is only one chair in the rooms with two Queens. How in the world can two, three, four people have a comfortable stay in bad weather? There is no fridge, even though the designated space is there and in the hazy, hot and humid weather of Florida, a fridge is a bare essential. Other than that there is no breakfast available, but a Waffle House on the property that serves good Omelettes. Having said that the rooms are clean, the pool area is clean, the staff is knowledgeable and friendly, there is a concierge desk all day to help with reservations and directions. You should ask for a room which is not at the direction of A1A.

Reviews.Title: “Meth Head Central!”
Reviews.Author: camiepeach
Reviews.Content: I am not the one to write reviews about places but I feel the need to write one for our stay at this place. We chose the cheapest hotel option in Key West so we can spend money on other things to do there. So with this being said I was not expecting anything fancy or extreme comfort. We stayed 3 nights here and every night we heard people fighting, screaming, pounding on doors, and of course they were up talking all night and I mean all night doing whatever people do at 3am. This was not just in one room as we heard it on each side of our room and the room below us. One guy was talking to another man about how he was out on parole blah blah blah.....another at 3am was outside our room saying he needed to "p*ss" and was going to in one of the a/c vents outside the room because he couldn't get into his hotel room. The walls are so thin I even heard the people in the room next to us evertime they urinated in the toilet. And I cant forget about everyday at 8am like clockwork the hotel maid and her cart come stomping through the pathway which was so loud! The a/c would not stay on constantly to block the noise out...ours kept turning off and on every 15 min. We travel alot and this has definitelty the worst hotel ever! So I am advising to whoever wants to stay in a budget hotel while visiting Key West PLEASE spend he extra $30 a night and stay somewhere else! You will be hapy you did!

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad Days Inn, parking lot gets very full/crowded at night”
Reviews.Author: Steph H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was the cheapest option we could find in Key West during Christmas as we booked on short notice. We ended up in a smoking room due to booking late. The room was clean and as a non-smoker, the smoke smell wasn't too bad. Overall the room was more spacious than expected. The beds weren't in the best condition but none of the 4 of us staying in the room had any trouble sleeping. My only issue with the hotel is that when we got in late on the two nights we stayed there, the parking lot was almost full. Additionally there were several people just standing around in the parking lot blocking spaces and blocking the parking lot itself. It was really annoying. It didn't feel unsafe or anything, however if I had been traveling alone it definitely would have bothered me more. It's worth noting that although the parking lot is pretty well lit some of the areas where the rooms are located are not as well illuminated. Our room did not directly face the parking lot and walking around behind the room at night, it was quite dark. Although I'd go back to this hotel, I wouldn't patronize it if I were a solo traveler.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE”
Reviews.Author: maria b
Reviews.Content: we arrived at 3am to the first place we saw, which was days inn.. it was $99/night ... (crazy).. thinking it would atleast be nice we decided to just stay .... the room was supposed to be non-smoking room, well happened to be the most disgusting room ever, filled with smoke... i have asthma so i had to make sure they gave us another room, the other one was a little better, sheets were dirty, towels were not folded like if they were already used,.... just gross.. save ur money stay somewhere else.. not worth it all...

Reviews.Title: “Pour le prix, c'etait bien / Great quality-price ratio”
Reviews.Author: CudaJeff
Reviews.Content: Nous sommes allÃ© Ã  cet endoit pour une nuit en avril 2010. Nous avons payÃ© $100 pour la nuit. Ce n'est pas le gros luxe mais c'Ã©tait propre et calme. Le service Ã©tait aussi trÃ¨s bien. Il y'a un Waffle house sur place. Excellent pour dÃ©jeuner avec la famille! --------------------------------------------------- We stayed in this hotel for one night in April 2010. We paid $100 for the night. This is not a palace but it was clean and quiet. The service was great too. There's a Waffle House on site. Great for breakfast with the family!

Reviews.Title: “This place was very gross”
Reviews.Author: vacationdealqueen
Reviews.Content: We semi-randomly ended up coming to Key West earlier than anticipated. The hotel was had booked for our trip was full and wasn't able to accommodate our early arrival. We arrived pretty late in the evening so most hotels were booked or too expensive to warrant so much for a few hours sleep so we stayed here as it is the cheapest place to stay in Key West I think. Our room smelled really bad. The bed and sheets and blanket were gross. The bathroom was also gross and there were hairs on the tile and wall and the bath just filled with water when my friend tried to take a shower because the drain was clogged. Area and waffle house next door looked ikcy as well. Please just spring for an extra thirty a night to stay someplace better.

Reviews.Title: “New to the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Although the overnight rate was very steep(weekend rates)all the lobby personal(Jessica,Laura, Odone)were very helpful in situating me to a new geographical area..they helped with picking a good dinner spot and after check-out allow me to use the internet in the lobby for job searching.

Reviews.Title: “Days Inn Key West for Fantasy Fest”
Reviews.Author: Florida777
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 9:30am and the front desk guy was very cool, laid back and not only allowed me an early check-in, they upgraded my room! It was twice the size as a normal room and on the first floor! Thanks! I will be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “It is what it is”
Reviews.Author: IKnowBBQ
Reviews.Content: It's pretty clean. There is a reason it's one of the cheapest hotels in key west. It's a little old and rundown but for the money it was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Typical Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: georden
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in November 2011. The hotel is older and could use some upgrading. The beds were hard and the walls are paper thin. There is a Waffle House attached to the Days Inn so they do not serve a breakfast. The room did have a seperate closet and a digital thermostat for easy temperature adjustment. The TV is an old analog set with about 70 channels. The office staff is very nice and helpful. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Key West Welcome center and a stop for the Old Town Trolley which is a nice way to tour the city.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the service”
Reviews.Author: sokeen1
Reviews.Content: The room we had was adequate and it was clean. I feel that there are other accommodations on this property that are much better than the room we had. However, where this facility was EXCELLENT was in the staff. Patty, Jessica, Jeff and Odone were absolutely amazing. The service provided was 6 star. I highly recommend this hotel based solely on the service provided by this amazing team.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marcial S
Reviews.Content: all I can says is BED BUGS !!!!!! all over, it suck, it stinks, very disgusting and its not worth to pay so you can sleep with BED BUGS!!! Don't make a reservation in this hotel run before the bugs get you !!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Crappiest place ever!”
Reviews.Author: kcmom13
Reviews.Content: If you want cheap you will definitely have it at this location but that is the only highlight of this establishment.The room could barely be called clean and the employees, aside from a very nice housekeeper, were all very rude and disrespectful.

Reviews.Title: “Very decent value hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Consultantgal
Reviews.Content: The Key West Day's Inn is a motel, it is not a luxury hotel. It is, however, a great place to stay in Key West if you are looking for a great bargin. The room was very clean, the beds were comfortable and the staff was way above average for a motel. All the common areas of the hotel were very nice and well maintained. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Give them a try. You won't be sorry.”
Reviews.Author: threepercenter
Reviews.Content: Spent nine nights of vacation here. The staff could not have possibly been friendlier or more helpful. As another reviewer said, Patty was a delight. Room was kept clean and was more than enough for our purposes. Didn't spend a lot of time at the pool but it was great the time we were there. If you go to Key West to hang out in the room and watch TV then this may not be the place for you. We went to have fun out and about. Needed a place to sleep at night and regroup during the day. Days Inn Key West was perfect for this and had the most reasonable rates we could find. We will be checking back with them for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Room was OK, GREAT staff!”
Reviews.Author: horsedoc24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Days Inn while in the Keys for our anniversary. We just needed a cheaper (we were on a budget for the trip) option just for 1 night. When we arrived, the nicest woman checked us in. I beleive her name was Patty and she was so nice. Our room was pretty nice, a fuse kept blowing in the bathroom, but we weren't too inconvenienced so we decided not to move. We told the desk so that they could correct it after we checked out. The pool was very nice! We had a rental car, so it was not a big deal for us to drive downtown and park (off season). The hotel is far from the downtown area though. Overall we had a nice stay. The room was very basic but clean and comfy. We would stay here again if ever in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: new2ohio05
Reviews.Content: The room over all was clean, nice and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean; management very helpful.”
Reviews.Author: fieldschild
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and grounds well kept. My friend happened to give the front desk her expired credit card at check-in and we were locked out of our room when we returned from shopping. We didn't know whqat had happened and we freaked out because all of her and her husbands cards were left in their suitcase and we couldn't get in to get them. We finally were able to talk the manager into letting her enter the room to retrieve the correct card. After that was settled, we had no further problem.

Reviews.Title: “Will like to give a positive review but Bed Bugs messed it up!”
Reviews.Author: dallylta2
Reviews.Content: I stood for three days at the Days Inn. I was in room 254. It is affordable, pool is nice and the front desk night rep is great. I also liked that is was next to Waffle House. You will need a taxi from the motel, because Duval Street is not walkable distance. On my last day I wanted to sleep in and then drive to Miami to spend the rest of my vacation. My husband woke up around 6:30am to use the bathroom and he noticed there was a bug on his shorts. My husband being a IT geek googled Bed Bugs and it was it. He told me to get off the bed and when we turned the sheets there was a couple of bed bugs. I immediately packed our stuff and checked out. I told the front desk person which was a woman and she called housekeeping immediately. She tried to tell me that it was not bed bugs, because I was not bitten, but it was. What sucks is that a soon as we arrived to Miami I had to wash all of our clothes at a local laundrymatt. I also now have bite marks all over arms and back. I am hoping is not bed bugs going to the Doctors. I tried looking up corporate's information and I could not find it. I hope they fixed that problem, because the hotel is not that bad.

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great price to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: shanjonthurman
Reviews.Content: Key West is Ã  resort town so you expect it to be expensive. We stayed at 3 different hotels and you would think that Days Inn being the cheapest on the Island would compromise the quality, but we had Ã  totally awesome 3 days there. Patty checked us in and where most people have ignored my 3 year old son, she came out from behind the desk and made a point of talking to him and giving him a high five. She was very welcoming and the one small issue we had during our stay she resolved within 10 minutes and went above and beyond to make sure things were right. When I accidentally de-magnetized my keys Laura was at the desk and fixed them quickly and with a smile. Our room was clean and cool and when we were out on the 3rd day we came back to find our beds made, new towels on the rack and everything refreshed and replaced. I wasnt impressed with the food (but keep in mind my hubby is a chef so I'm a bit of a food snob) at the Waffle House but the waitstaff were attentive and full of suggestions on things to do. The location is great if you dont want to deal with the crowds and noise of downtown but still be a block from the beach. The pool was clean but we were too busy to make use of it. Theres plenty of local wildlife, we got to see a pretty big iguana! I would definately come back and recommend others to enjoy what Patty and Days Inn have to offer, comfort and care at the best price in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Continue to come back!!”
Reviews.Author: JM2288
Reviews.Content: This is an average hotel, nothing fancy just a place to sleep pretty much. Its clean and simple.Ac always works, never had problems w/ bugs or dust,mold. Rooms are outdated but not terrible. Beds are comfy and clean. I have stayed here plenty of times because its the best price on the island. If your looking for a reasonably priced clean place to stay and not planning to spend all your time in the room, this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Budget end of the scale for Keywest”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night as our flight arrived late in the evening and we had spent 24 hours travelling from the UK through Tampa and then a flight to Keywest The staff were really friendly on reception The room was OK for one night but not somewhere i would want to stay for a holiday as it was too far from the nightflife but it was good value for Keywest so if you are on a budget then this may be good value The room opened directly onto the carpark and the lock did not look too good so we spent the night joking about the Pulp Fiction movie- but we had no problems

Reviews.Title: “Excellent receptionists-very friendly! But rooms small and very noisy!”
Reviews.Author: FY1987
Reviews.Content: All the reception staff were very friendly and welcoming. Bedrooms were small, dark, tiny bathroom, no iron. Pool was decent. During our stay we were woken the next morning at 7.30 am by roomkeeping staff making noise outside our room, added with loud air conditioning I had an awful nights sleep.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to go back my family loved it.”
Reviews.Author: patrice067
Reviews.Content: My family can't wait to go back. we loved every part of the stay and we hope to see you soon. The staff was very helpful and informative of the surrounding area which made our trip easier. the rooms were exceptionally clean and nice, and upon demand we ordered an extra bed and it was supplied to us.the pool was clean and at a perfect temperature. P.S Great coffee and hot chocolate

Reviews.Title: “Would book again”
Reviews.Author: goodfood4u
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to have an intelligent and capable staff [ODONE and LAURA] We had 4 people for 2 nights. For a hotel in this price range we have no complaints. Would stay again. However, the Wi-Fi did not work in the room or the lobby. Went to Mc Donalds to use the computer.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Bright & Cheap Option”
Reviews.Author: MoniJ315
Reviews.Content: This is not a resort or high priced hotel so don't expect it. It's a clean night's stay. The rooms were brightly decorated and while they showed aged it wasn't as if the place hadn't been maintained. Waffle house attached to lobby has a dollar menu but we chose to eat in Old Town during our stay. They have someone in the lobby during the day that can help you with maps and attractions. Budget plenty of money for parking, at least $10/day, as there is little to no free parking near attractions and location is well away from almost all of them. It is not a super quiet place as it's right at the entrance to the key but overall we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: JessJones623
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West for only one night and this Days Inn was in a great location. It's located about ten minutes from the downtown area of Key West, but is still close to many other great things in Key West. The hotel staff was very friendly and knowledgeable of the area, they even gave us free drink coupons!! Check-in was convenient, as we did not have a reservation and walked in to the lobby around 4 pm and had a room in 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Don't spoil your holiday, stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Jenkinscm2001
Reviews.Content: Not a great place, dirty, dark room that are overpriced. Would suggest you stay away from this hotel. Certainly not value for money

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: adienikk
Reviews.Content: Is clean, just in the principal avenue of Key West. For the price per night is great have a king suite bed and kitchenette! The service A plus!!!

Reviews.Title: “I loved it very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: amol23
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for two days. location was fantastic and people were friendly. hotel was clean enough front desk was very friendly. no spa no gym but pool was fantastic. very nice atmosphere. break fast was good hotel features very good tourist services guidance and designated person at the desk who guides for sight seeing

Reviews.Title: “Too far and dirty. Spend the extra bucks and save in taxis.”
Reviews.Author: Jeskot7
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel thinking we were saving money but by the time we took taxis to Duval Street and/or paid for parking we would have saved money paying just a bit more to be closer to all the action and probably ended up in a cleaner place. The chairs in the room were visibly stained..that was what I could see.. The element that stays in the hotel is not exactly middle class. The a/c did run very well and kept our room ice cold.

Reviews.Title: “OK given the area, time of year and price..”
Reviews.Author: TruckDriverFritz
Reviews.Content: This place was given a few very negative reviews and truthfully, I can see why, but our stay was OK. This is an older motel, heavily used, in the tropics. We stayed at high season, on a weekend and after a bit had a really nice room. I'll explain... For the price this place is very busy with college age, seniors, families and groups, also this was a "biker" weekend. I felt lucky to get anything. When I checked in (a bit late around 7pm) I wasn't surprised to be told in no uncertain terms, that we had the last room on property. It was pretty terrible, so I returned to the desk and the same clerk said, you're in luck, we just had a room open up. Next room, really nice, clean, sweet smelling, large second floor, away from the very busy pool. In retrospect, I think they try to "un-load" the not-so-nice rooms so they have a few good ones in reserve... You never know when the President may drop in..... PS the on-site Waffle House is the best (cheap) food deal on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: RollingStonefromFL
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 302 ($152.14 for one night). Hopefully floor layout helps. Next time I will try to get room close to 101-110 (211-220 second floor accordingly) that located closest to entrance. Room 101 is the closest to entrance. Place is old (definitely not Marriott style). Room was huge, plus sort of living room with full size fridge and microwave, coffee-maker and couple bags of coffee, no utensils. No problem with two of A/C units, one in each room, bath-room was just average size with 2 sets of towels and little shampoo and soaps, TV's were old, remotes were working, no noises, no insects, no any other problems. Two ice-makers, one by elevator, one by the pool were working fine. Pool is small, but clean and there was a shower. Bed was big enough and rather comfortable. Carpet cleanliness is only draw-back, it was washed long time ago (I wore my shoes all the time) plus some folks were smoking out-side. Not recommend for those who cannot stand cigarette smoke or anything related to smoking. No continental break-fast, although coffee machine is in the lobby. Far from Duval street and all entertainment, have to drive, but only few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap & Cheerfull, for Key West”
Reviews.Author: MadMurdock
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for a couple of nights as part of a tour of southern Florida. The highlight of this place had to be the heated outdoor pool! It was like getting into a warm bath. No other hotels we stayed in, including alot more expensive ones had pools as good! The rest was like an average motel. Nothing outstanding, but no problems either. We had alot of luggage as we were living out of a suitcase for two weeks, and there wasn't an elevator near our room, so it was a bit of a lug up & down the stairs. The location wasn't great for downtown Key West, and was a taxi trip each time. We paid around $100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole34467
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice. The room was clean. Needed a little updating in the decor. It had a great breakfast. The pool was very nice and our kids had a fun time swimming. My complaint was the noise! The hours of the pool posted were until 11 p.m. There was a bar at poolside. So it was obvious that people were enjoying it until late. People were in the pool laughing and carrying on, very loudly, past 1 in the morning. Rude! Most of the doors of the rooms face the pool, and so I'm sure we were not the only ones who were disturbed. Thought the management should have controled the hours like posted.

Reviews.Title: “pricey for the quality - but this is key West”
Reviews.Author: Reginald_Chung
Reviews.Content: Hotel was OK, not great. and pretty expensive (as I guess most things are in Key West). A little noisy but not bad. pretty average.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, friendly staff, poor location”
Reviews.Author: AnnaS8297
Reviews.Content: The hotel accommodated an early check-in for us, which was great, and all of the staff was incredibly friendly and helpful. The rooms do not have microwaves or minifridges, a definite draw-back for us. But, the room was clean, nicely decorated and updated. The pool area was clean, the pool is heated and the grounds are well maintained. We could hear noise in the mornings which was disappointing since the best part of vacation for us is getting to sleep in. The concierge in the lobby gave us some buy-one-get-one-free drink coupons and a map. The hotel is as far away from Duval Street as physically possible on the Island and they don't offer any kind of shuttle service. Cab fare runs about $18 each way. Overall, for the value, we would definitely stay at the Days Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “You DON"T get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: SummertonZephyrhills
Reviews.Content: I understand it is Key West - but at most it is a 29.99 room that I paid 142$ Do not try to save a couple bucks here, you can stay in a nice room for that much. Shower had black mold !!!!! YEAH!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place!”
Reviews.Author: seanruss
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because it was fairly inexpensive amongst a long list of pricey motels. After we got here we decided we were totally ripped off and it would have been better to spend $150 per night for a nice hotel rather than spend $80 a night for this dump! And a dump this place was. We asked for a double bed room in the non-smoking section, but our first room smelled badly of cigarette smoke. Our second room was better, but not a lot. When we got to our second room the toilet did not work and we had to get a plunger for it, which they just handed to me and left for me to take care of. Afterwords the night manager would not even come to the desk to take it back, she just stayed in her room watching videos on her computer. Another thing that bothered us is that for $80 a night, at the very minimum we expected a refrigerator in the room, which there was none. Also, there was almost no water pressure at all, and the hot water ran out before we all finished our showers. So, if you really want a nice vacation - don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “UR BEST BANG FOR THE FAMILY BUCK IN KEY WEST, FOLKS!”
Reviews.Author: ThriftyCanuck
Reviews.Content: We'd been to Key West three times before, but this was the first time with our teenage daughters, who can be pretty fussy. Spotless rooms, great AC, clean pool area, 24-hr Waffle House....and at the quiet end of Key West for sound sleeping!!! .......and cheap like borscht!!!! I mean, what's not to like??? If you want to pay $200+ per night so you can go back home & tell everybody that you "stayed @ A RESORT"....then fill yer boots!!! BUT, if you want good value, free parking, security, a cheap price PLUS CHEAP DEALS ON PARA-SAILING, CATAMARAN RIDES, etc etc.....this Day's Inn is hard to beat in Key West. We signed up for ALL the deals.....and they were first class......even for our discerning teenage drama queens!! Honestly, I couldn't believe some of the negative reviews here. Seems there's a certain percentage of travellers who find "the soup's too hot & the ice-water is too cold" eh!!??

Reviews.Title: “Great price,Clean and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Simmon53
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in Key West for a Conference and didn't want to get ripped again by the high price of the conference location/hotel so we stayed at the Days inn. Big room, quiet and clean. Bed was very comfortable. It would have been nice to have a mini frig in the room. We felt the location was good: turn left or turn right to go. Very good price. Next year we will definitly return to stay at the Days Inn Key West

Reviews.Title: “This was an okay spring break hotel”
Reviews.Author: vacationdealqueen
Reviews.Content: I really didn't think this place was that bad, and I am normally a pretty picky gal. A group of friends and I did Key West Spring Break round 2. The hotel we stayed at the year prior wasn't available and being poor college kids we were on a budget so we stayed here. You can tell from their website it is not the best hotel or location, but Key West is so small nothing is more than 10 minutes from the main drag. We got two rooms right next to each other. We plan on staying at a nicer place next spring break, but honestly we did not have a bad experience here, because we were barely at the hotel at all. We were enjoying Key West. This place was also very cheap, so it was fine for our purposes. The rooms weren't gross at all, the immediate area was definitely iffy though.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good choice”
Reviews.Author: kwres
Reviews.Content: The wi-fi they claim they have does not work at all. There is no water pressure, and the Front desk staff isn't all that friendly or helpful. On the plus side, the beds are comfortable and the area is quiet. The parking is on-site and free, and seemed to be secure. The A/C cooled the room, but was quite noisy all night.

Reviews.Title: “too cheap”
Reviews.Author: dennistrave
Reviews.Content: This was the cheapest place we could find and we've decided not to make our future stays all about low cost. Key West is an expensive place, just need to face it. We won't stay here again, but it is not as bad as some reviewers have said. It's OK, is just on the cheap end of the scale for this city. Best feature is probably accessibility of coffee and waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Decent and Clean”
Reviews.Author: jdemont1
Reviews.Content: I would say that for a 2-star rated hotel, the place was decent, clean, had a large room and a separate living room. For the price paid, it was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here unless ur flat broke on...”
Reviews.Author: Phinfever85
Reviews.Content: Don't stay here unless ur flat broke on your vaca!!

Reviews.Title: “Works if your on a budget”
Reviews.Author: BeachBums5768
Reviews.Content: okay so its not a resort but for the price we paid ( online we found a really good deal on a suite with full kitchen and king size bed ) it worked well. The fridge was clean and there was also a microwave. You could tell the hotel was aged but we didn't stay inside much. It was convenient that we drove because this hotel is at the very front of the key so the drive to the beach and duval was decent. Enjoyed our stay, very good for the price, and decent for the amenities comparable to other hotels on the key.

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a high-priced renovated Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: fiziks8282
Reviews.Content: General this Days Inn was okay. The rooms were old but renovated and they were clean. In fact, the whole motel is obviously an old Motel 6 type that has been renovated. The prices were about double what I would have expected for what they offered. It is much farther from old Key West than suggested in the literature. I would not stay there again if I ever visit Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: ensc23
Reviews.Content: We paid $135 with tax to stay in this hotel - it was not worth it. The beds and room were tiny and uncomfortable, it was a really cramped stay. The shower had almost no hot water. It was definitely not worth the price and we only stayed 1 night or else we would have spent our money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely pool tho not close to Dwtn Key West.”
Reviews.Author: travelingterry53
Reviews.Content: We stayed over St. Patrick's Day. The Days Inn Key West is not close to Dwtn Key West and is not a 4-6 star motel. I chose the Days Inn because of its price(under $120 less taxes)night and it had a wonderful heated pool. Our room was very clean, it had a decent bathroom with the sink outside of the shower/toilet area. The closet was fine, the tv worked and the A/C cooled the room off. If you have a car, its only a 10 minute drive to Dwtn, we rented bicycles($18/day) and it took us 30minutes each way. It was a wonderful way to see the island. I would rate the Days Inn at 2.5stars.

Reviews.Title: “it's worth the price paying”
Reviews.Author: dirtywhiteboy616
Reviews.Content: I am Currently sitting on the balcony looking out at roosavelt. I am here with a group of Buddies from Canada, for what we are doing (sitting around drinking and enjoing the sun) it is very well done. this is probly really well done for family vacation. the only downfall is that its far to Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Last resort”
Reviews.Author: Oldfitzman
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for one night because nothing else was available at the price range, room we stayed in was supposed to be a suite (kings size bed and sleeper sofa) looked like someone slept in the sleeper sofa the night before and the mattress was un-clean and sheets were not changed window was broke and taped together with plastic tape back slider broke could only open partially closet door broke off hinges TV remote had no batteries in it

Reviews.Title: “Dated, dirty, poor location”
Reviews.Author: travelcd
Reviews.Content: Upon check in the toilet did not work. The noise from the bathroom fan could be categorized as crual and inhuman. The noise drew attention to the dirt accumulation in and around the bathroom fan which could help anyone feel ill. Our children refused to remove their shoes in the room as they felt the carpet was too dirty to walk upon. Our 14 year old refused to shower at this property. We checked out after a single evening and moved elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “ONLY GO TO THIS HOTEL AS A LAST RESORT”
Reviews.Author: over22
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel on February 11 and I first noticed that this hotel looked like a 1970's reject. The minute we stepped in the room, I noticed that the room smelled terrible. It was also cold for a night in Key West and when we tried to use the heater and it did not work. I called the front office and they sent down a maintenance man and he said that we had to move to another room. When we arrived at the other room, the heater was working and the smell was better (but still there) and, we were missing one chair and the remote control to the TV was not there. The maintenance man got us a new remote control for the TV but, the chair he brought for us looked and smelled terrible. I took a shower and laid down to go to sleep but, I felt like I had a film covering my body (NASTY) and I had a hard time sleeping during the night. My family and I went to check out the next day and we were only able to get a complimentary newspaper for all the BS we put up with the night before. The breakfast at the Waffle House was OK and so was the service at the hotel and the newspaper was nice but, I'm not going back to this hotel and my suggestion to you is not to go there either unless you have no other choice. ONLY GO TO THIS HOTEL AS A LAST RESORT.

Reviews.Title: “Dont Believe the Negative Hype, Value Traveller”
Reviews.Author: vegasguy10
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews I was scared that I had made a major mistake but with a savings of nearly 50% over the next priced hotel it was too good not to try. I will add that I flew for a living with the US Marine Corps and stayed in 100's of hotels both in the US and around the world. This hotel would not rate in the top half but it is far better than many hotels with big promises. Friendly staff with concierge service, decent pool and the best rate in Key West (trust me I tried). My stay started with an online purchase which turned out to be a huge savings for a 3 night stay. We were upgraded to a suite that was smoking but the living room was the only room that the smell was noticable. Having a full size fridge, sofa and comfortable second room was worth the tradeoff on the smoking room. I have stayed in many rooms converted to nonsmoking rooms that had the exact same smell but no break in price, We had a King bed with a balcony and a bathroom shared by the two rooms. All of the interiors were dated but it appeared clean and was comfortable. Cabs will be the best bet for travel to Duval St (the main street) but $15.35/trip is worth the savings. To summarize: this hotel is not the Ritz Carlton that's why its branded a Days Inn. Considering the price and being in Key West there isn't a better option. To the bad reviewers I say either pay the money for a high-end brand or get out of the room and enjoy Duval St instead.

Reviews.Title: “If You Like Icky, This Is For You”
Reviews.Author: Seairail
Reviews.Content: If you have positively no other choice than to have to stay at this hotel, do yourself a big favor and bring your own bedding (sheets, pillows, blankets) towels wouldn't hurt either. This is an old hotel that is in desperate need of refurbishing. You can only spray so much Lysol or Fabreze or whatever to mask the problems and that is exactly what Housekeeping is doing. The room overwhelms you with the "air spray cover up". Fortunately, we did not have to stay in the room that much, but when we did, sleeping was difficult with the bedding having been sprayed. Even the pillows. The carpet was dirty and the bathroom tub could have been better cleaned. The Lobby Check-In staff is pleasant and efficient, but that doesn't make up for their product. As far as location goes, it really doesn't make too much difference on Key West, as most everything is in close proximity. This hotel has a 24 hr. diner adjoining the lobby that complements the lodging facilities. It's an Awful House, if you get my drift. So, not to belabor the point, for a few dollars more you should be able to find much better accommodations on Key West. My problem was that I got "locked in" on price by one of the discount web sites that would not identify the hotel until after I agreed to their "bargain" price and submitted my credit card. Alas, too late.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I expected”
Reviews.Author: valerie_c_vfh
Reviews.Content: Key West hotels are expensive even during the low season. Got this hotel on Hotwire for a half decent price, but comparing to 4* I went to during our trip that were the same price, it was not a very good deal.The beds were not very steady or comfortable and I kept my shoes on while walking in the room. The room was clean, but there was a lot of wear and tear on everything and it just didn't feel all that comfortable. On the plus side had free Wifi, check-in/out offered adequate service and parking was free. I would not go there again, but if you are in a tight financial situation, this might be your only choice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mercury2622
Reviews.Content: An OK hotel. A bit out of the centre of Key West, and for just a few more bucks can be in the middle of it all. A bit on the expensive side.

Reviews.Title: “we weren't happy”
Reviews.Author: inolepehc
Reviews.Content: first off, we've heard it before ... "you get what you pay for" .... it's one of the cheapest hotels in key west, true. let me tell you about my experience. i booked through hotwire after searching online for a few days, first i was checking out days inn website and there the rate was 99, then it went up to 129, i guess that's the way it is and rates go up and down for different reasons. then i checked hotwire and the rate was 116, so at least i was saving $14 per night. i booked it. it was a non smoking double bed room, when i was at the counter the lady very politely asked me if i would like to get a king size bed room, but smoking, i am a smoker so i agreed but completely forgot about my wife, she can tolerate the smell of smoke BUT when we opened the door of that room, it was really smelly, not even i could resist it. i admit it was my BIG mistake. they tried to fix it, first they sprayed the room (feebreze or something like that), then an ozone machine, but it was the same, they kept telling me they didn't have anything else available and when i asked for my original reservation, they told me that when i gave it up, someone else took it. i have relatives that work in the hotel industry so i kinda know how some things work ..... all of a sudden and after maybe an hour, a double bed non smoking room was available (??). we were happy, but not for too long. we opened the new room and it was still smelly. it's an old place, it's not the worst thing, don't get me wrong, but "you get what you pay for" so don't expect anything else. we couldn't take it, and asked for a cancellation of our reservation (it was paid for through hotwire and eventhough they say there's no refunds ....... but well, that's another story but let me tell you the hotel staff was very nice and let me go) . next door there's a holiday inn, we went there, asked to check out the room before we pay for, and it's just as old as days inn but it didn't smell THAT bad, but it was 48 dollars more expensive, but oh well. i don't want to say i would or would not recommend these 2 hotels (although i have to make a choice in order to publish this review) but if you can afford to spend a bit more money, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Overly priced dump”
Reviews.Author: lovespain
Reviews.Content: Of course we did stay at this hotel on New Year's Eve and it was the ONLY place in Key West where you did not have to stay numerous nights. My husband and I stayed only one night - New Year's Eve. We paid $336 for ONE night and this place is your standard dump. It is very basic and old. We stay in Key West a lot and I have to say that this was my least favorite place. The location is also awful. You have to take a cab to Duval Street (where we usually stay) as it is a good five miles away. If you step out of the hotel you are at a Waffle House (ick) and right on a very, very busy highway. You are not on the water and in fact I doubt there is even a pool here. We never saw one. The night before this we stayed at the Hard Rock in Hollywood, FL and boy what a difference (we only paid $99 at the Hard Rock and it is first class all the way). I would not stay here again. Thank goodness we only showered and slept there for a quick one night.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable hotel, although expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Solyluna
Reviews.Content: The hotel is pricey, but it was the cheapest we could find. It is true that it is a bit dated, but it is well maintained, clean and comfortable. We spend just one night ($278 + tax) and it was just what we needed: a well located place with comfortable and clean beds. It had two double beds, a TV with cable, a chair to sit down, a closet with a small safe. It also had a small coffee maker and a hair dryer (which wasn't working). The bathroom was clean, and it was the right size. We checked in and out quickly; the staff was friendly and worked promptly. The hotel has two floors; you can climb the stairs or take the elevator. I wandered through the hotel: there is a swimming pool, an ice machine, and plenty of free parking space. Next to the reception was a Waffle House, which we didn't visit, but less than a 5 minute drive there is an IHOP, Denny's and McDonalds. Good place that we would recommend in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DJENKINS16617
Reviews.Content: The wife and I decided to spend Christmas week in Key West to get away from the cold back home in Pa. We booked a suite at the Days Inn. The place is easy to find for starters. Just as you arrive on the island of Key West on Rte 1 (N. Rosevelt Ave) there it is. The check in was fast and we were off to our suite. The entire hotel is surrounded by tropical plants and palm trees. A nice change from the brown and cold back home. The pool is clean and well kept and again, lush foliage everywhere. The room was spacious and clean with no mold/mildew or those other assorted funky smells we've all seen in a hotel or 2. The suites have 2 large rooms. One for sleeping and a living room area. 2 TV's, one in each room plus a full size fridge and microwave. The suite's have a private balcony to sit out and enjoy the warm evening breeze's. The housekeeping staff did a great job daily. There is a Waffle House on premises but we never got a chance to eat there so I can't comment on that. Too many other eateries in Key West I wanted to try. The price was a pleasant suprise. The entire week with the AAA discount came to $1039.00. Not bad for a week in paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and Would Go Again in a Heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: heidileduc
Reviews.Content: You could not find a bad hotel when your in Key West, FL, but even though we went economy it's the only way I would go again. They offer a diner and free coffee and fruit in the morning and they have someone there to direct you to all the attractions, I would not recommend renting a car!!! I would either rent scooters or call a taxi the parking lot prices are really expensive. This Inn was super CLEAN had a full kitchen, livingroom, bathroom and bedroom, with a view of the Island, and a very well kept pool area. 5 Stars

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Malo195809
Reviews.Content: Well we arrived at the hotel late evening, the staff were extremely helpful. Light refreshment available in the foyer area 24 hrs and access to WiFi. Key West is a place to go to soak up the culture and relax. All the years that we have been going to Florida (10) I wish we had made the trip sooner. A fantastic place, friendly and helpful people.

Reviews.Title: “OK for overnight”
Reviews.Author: AnneCManchester
Reviews.Content: You need a car if you stay here. Cheap and you get what you pay for. Reasonably spacious, seemed clean. Easy to find at the end of a long drive down the Keys. Free parking is an advantage. Don't expect luxury but is OK for overnight,

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely filthy”
Reviews.Author: Teachall
Reviews.Content: If we had seen the reviews before we booked this, we would have saved ourselves a lot of pain. The walls, & floor were filthy. The sheets & towels were clean--thank goodness. This place reeked of cleaning solutions. I really don't know where they were used. Yes, it is one of the cheapest places in the Keys. But, it is filthy.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy!”
Reviews.Author: AlexisNic
Reviews.Content: If we weren't so tired, we would have checked out whether they refunded our money or not. In the morning we contemplated whether taking a shower in that filth would be better or worse than just not showering at all. Soap and water have not touched anything in that room in 20 years. I am going to have nightmares for a while.

Reviews.Title: “outrageous service”
Reviews.Author: duvalny
Reviews.Content: Thank God I was there only for one night. If I had to stay for more than that I would've try find another place. I went to the reception and ask for some ice or directions to a place to buy water. the receptionist sent me to an ice machine that was out of service also to a vending machine in a similar condition. I bet they were aware of that since it was suggested to me to ask for ice to the waffle house next to the reception. In the morning I went down to the reception with my family. WhileI was in the line having another person in front at the juice machine, I have experienced Jorge's services. The cleaning guy. He shutt off the juice machine right in front of me with no consideration that I was in the line trying to get a cup of juice for my 2 yrs old daughter. I didn't got what was going on thinking that he may have to refill the juice machine tank but when I realized that he was about to leave and the machine wasn't working anymore I ask and he said is 10am and he turned off the machine. On top of everything else that happen in my short staying there that was the thing that ticked me off. Not to mention that I had my daughter crying next to me for a cup of juice that I had to go buy from the waffle house. Probably that was the policy to get the guests going next door. I will not go back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nathanwpugh
Reviews.Content: The Key West Days Inn is a great option for someone unwilling to hand over hundreds of dollars for a hotel in Key West. It may not be downtown, but it's a quick drive or bus ride away. (It is actually possible to walk if willing to travel a few miles along A1A or US-1.)The rooms are clean, the staff is friendly, and the free parking is more than adequate. This option is perfect for someone desiring a simple, yet adequate and clean place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Not good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Jirizq
Reviews.Content: This is normal Motel 6 with price of the hotel. I have been really disappointed by this hotel. The room smell really bad. The carpet and chairs was not really clean. And don't go to the waffle house which is located in same building it's total disaster.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pdtaylor
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Day's Inn in Key West June 1st thru June 5th. The hotel room was very nice. If you are wanting a room with a fridge, ask before booking. The pool was spacious and the foilage around the area was beautiful. All the staff was very helpful and there is a washer and dryer on the site. You are a long ways from downtown. You will want to rent a scooter or car. We would use this site again should we come back.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of a drive from the action- but excellent room!”
Reviews.Author: racrac02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with another couple. We shared a room. We got the bedroom and they stayed on the sleeper sofa in the living room. The room was not fancy, but it was HUGE! There was a full sized refrigerator and the room was very comfortable. It was nothing fancy, but when I travel, I would rather spend money on food and drinks than on being spoiled. It was quite a ways away from Duvall, so someone had to stay sober or we took a cab, but it was not loud and I will always have fond memories of our trip to Key West because of that room!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: Wolfie469
Reviews.Content: I tried to make last minute reservations for Peterson's Poker Run, but this was the only available hotel. Reading the reviews on other sites, I wasn't expecting much and expected to be quite depressed since I was bringing my fussy wife. Not to worry. The place is very clean. Our room and beds were nice and, here's the kicker: the pool is outstanding which my wife loved. Large and set among jungle-like trees. Others have mentioned the tour conch train two doors down, which we took one day. I suppose if you're real fussy, you'd want to go somewhere else; but, if you count your coins it's quite satisfactory. For a nice upscale place, the Truman Hotel is great. However, we'll likely stay here in the future since it's such a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Not too shabby”
Reviews.Author: beentheredonethat08
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and i stayed here for our yearly trip to the Keys and we usually dont sped alot of time in out hotel cause we are always out doing things. I think this is a good deal it was clean and the pool was nice also we put our do not disturb sign and we never heard a peep! this is a good deal if you are on a budget and dont mind an older room. If you are visiting the Keys and want to stay in your room then this is not for you! but hey if you are in the Keys why stay in your room!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for a great value.”
Reviews.Author: kmoritz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not close to Duvall Street - however it is within a couple of blocks of the Conch Train or the Old Town Trolley. We had a nice 3 night stay at this hotel. The pool is a good size as well as nicely kept. Nice parking and a Waffle House on site. Denny's down the street. Not much with in walking distance other than other hotels and the trolley or train. I would definitely stay here again - we had a very nice relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Okay Place for the Price”
Reviews.Author: TotalRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: I came to Key West to work for 3 days. Stayed here 4 nights with 2 other people. We had a ground floor room. Be sure to ask, there are no elevators. The room was tired looking and not well lit, but otherwise, in reasonable repair. The safe did not work, but the clerk already said that when we checked in. The place could use a face lift, but it was acceptable. Others have noted smells, we did not have a problem. I always carry an air freshener when I travel. This is a typical motel folks, not the Ritz. The room was plenty big, beds comfortable, linens clean. There is no breakfast, but there is coffee. Clerk advised I would need to come to the lobby to use the Internet. It worked fine. No computer for guests, you have to bring your own. There was a mini fridge in the room that looked like it was brand new. No microwave, but there is one in the lobby you can use. Waffle House next door. Fine if you like that kind of food. This motel is situated right as you enter Key West. You are not close to anything, but that was not important to us. Plenty of free parking here, which is the exception, not the rule, in Key West. The air conditioner worked fine, but was loud. Plenty of hot water and water pressure. Sometimes that can be a problem in the Keys. To the folks who mentioned the roosters, they are everywhere in Key West. It can get annoying when you want to sleep in, but this place is no worse than anywhere else. We were early to bed, early to rise, until the last day. Then I was thinking "fried chicken?" but in all fairness, they are loud all over the island. They were wandering around everywhere we went. I have already booked 2 more return trips for business later this year. The parking is a big plus for me. I drive a large van while working and many places only have street parking which can sometimes leave you walking blocks at night.

Reviews.Title: “Really good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Adele_Finland
Reviews.Content: We booked our room here because it was cheap and we spent there only 1 night. We read all the reviews and thought we could be there that short time despite all bad reviews. When we arrived we were really cheerfully surprised. The motel was really nice, room clean and very roomy with two double beds! Only thing that didn't work was safety box. There were free parking and you could park your car close to your room. Breakfast was really good in the Waffle house. There were also pool middle of the house but we didn't have time to use it. You could use free internet in motel next door. It is quite far from the city centre (few miles) but we had a car and found good paid parking place ($10 ) which the motel personnel advised. Centre was really idyllic there are lot to see and it was a shame that we didn't have more time to spend there.

Reviews.Title: “okay for price”
Reviews.Author: NycCapegirl
Reviews.Content: Not bad for the price. Where else can you stay in KW for $89/night. I stayed with several girlfriends, we found the rooms to be clean, the pool was exceptionally clean, and the front desk people were friendly. Its a Days Inn, not the Ritz Carlton, so dont expect turndown service, but for a group trip it was a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “OK, Sort of”
Reviews.Author: TOG11
Reviews.Content: The Key West Days Inn is an older property located on the strip away from the action. The hotel needs a major overhaul, but the people try maintain the place. A real problem in Key West is mold due to the persistent high humidity, so keeping the rooms smelling good is a challenge. When I entered my room I smelled the strong odor of room deodorizer. It took a long time to air the place out (the windows do not open), but the room was clean and did not stink. The room was an ordinary motel which is fine. The Days Inn has no breakfast (only orange juice), no computer for guests and lousy Wifi in the rooms. I stayed in Key West the week before Christmas and found the rates to be high. The rates skyrocket for the week between Christmas and New Years. I have been to Key West several times and stayed at both the Comfort and Days Inn. The hotels are pretty similar except that the Comfort Inn offers a pretty good continental breakfast and it has a public computer. The rooms are pretty similar. Some of the rooms in each of the motels may stink due to mold or leaks and it is largely the luck of the draw for the degree of satisfaction for each room. If either the Days Inn or Comfort Inn were significantly less expensive I would chose that one immediately.

Reviews.Title: “Falling standards.......Rip off!!!!”
Reviews.Author: joluve
Reviews.Content: Althought it looked clean to the eyes, I found a small roach "walking" by the nigh table. The room door couldn't be locked from the inside because the knob was broken. Apparently they know it and it is been broken for long time because there was a "door chain" at the top. (at least that) The safe wasn't working either, and nither was working the bathtub faucet. Talking abouth bath, the shower curtain was broken at the top, the soup they provide smells ugly and so was the pillow. I had to spray some cologne over my pillow to be able to sleep. On top, the air conditioning noise was unbeatable. Their website shows a "breakfast area picture" but they do not provide any breakfast, just coffe. It is a totally misleading advertising to make the price acceptable. It could be the cheapest in the list but I seriously question where are the hotel standard priciples for hygiene and confort. At $30.00 rate it could be acceptable but at $90.00 it is a rip off!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: mid30stravel
Reviews.Content: I wanted a quick weekend get away and chose Key West (never been before). Since this was a quick guys weekend, we wanted to keep costs down and a place to sleep. So I pricelined the hotel and ended up with the Days Inn for $80 a night. The place was exactly what I expected. The hotel itself was ok. We checked in late at night and the front desk person was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean and updated but the room safe did not work. We weren't worried about the safe since we weren't leaving much in the room. The hotel is right at the entrance of Key West so having the rental car was helpful since most of the activity is around Duvall street. Parking at Days Inn is free. The next time I go to Key West I will look around Duvall. There seem to be bed and breakfast as well as other small hotels for not much more a night. As expected the guests at the Days Inn were a real mix of people.. young singles, families etc. At night, I got the sense it is not a good area. I saw one individual walk toward the car with a small bag of something, we signaled "no" and drove off. The front desk person told us that breakfast was provided but it "wasn't much". I appreciated the honesty. There is a Waffle House attached which we did not utilize. We preferred to eat at one of the many great places around the Keys. One afternoon, we were a bit tired so we went back and tried the pool. The pool was clean but the water was hot, which is what I expected, again this is the Days Inn and we are in Key West in August. The Days Inn is an ok place to stay. I felt safe being with friends but would not have felt comfortable if I went on my own. I would check into hotels/bed and breakfast around Duvall Street, especially if you are not bringing a car. If you do have a car and plan on staying around Duvall you will need to ask about parking. A few of the places did not provide parking.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap....But is it worth it????”
Reviews.Author: fordsho90
Reviews.Content: Place looks scary from the outside and is VERY dark at night. Suites are huge and seem to have been redone(our full size fridege still had the tape on the crispers) and it was comfy, bed wasnt the best but it worked. The foot traffic sucked it was going on most of the night. We had planned to stay for two night but did just one.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the price”
Reviews.Author: samnella
Reviews.Content: this was our first trip to key west. we were staying for a week with a teenage son. we were so glad we booked a suite, for the additional room. the suite was the size of a one bedroom apartment. the main bedroom was a separate room. the furnishings were sparse but adequate. there were 2 tv's, 2 a/c units which worked fine, one bath with 2 entrances, basic but clean; an island with 2 bar stools, a full size kitchen sink and full size refridgerator and micro; 2 closets and a sofa sleeper. we were on the back side ,so noise was not a problem; nor parking. the room was dimly lit, so we did have to ask for replacement light bulbs to replace the burnt out ones, and for additional towels. the room was clean, no smell, bugs or obvious stains. well worth the extra $10 US per night for the suite to get the extra space. the local chickens were a joy to watch, and not a nuisance at all. there was even a long-legged white water bird that flew into the pool area one day! the continental breakfast is very skimpy, and there's no where to sit.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, and not in a good way.”
Reviews.Author: eskierka
Reviews.Content: Where to I start? The room was a mess. The bathroom had been â€œcleanedâ€� but there was still a hair on the toilet when we arrived and the tub had a broken drain. The bed was broken and the mattresses were saggy and uncomfortable. Not only did the bed make the night long but the air conditioner that worked at half speed couldnâ€™t keep up with the heat. Perhaps it was the large crack in the window that rendered it insufficient. There were footprints on the door, the carpet was filthy and the door on the dresser was missing a handle. The light from the mini fridge shined though the doorâ€¦allâ€¦nightâ€¦long, and for an extra $30 they would give you the key to us it. The light on the night stand had melted the lamp shade in several spots and the electrical outlets had not affixed correctly leaving gaps into the wall. Outside was the same thing. We didnâ€™t have any problems with chickens but there was a thick smell of peppers that was repulsing. The dumpster was right under the stair. The daily smell of peppers and garbage in the heat was more then evident day and night and never went away for the 4 nights we were there. One of the air conditioners down the hall from our room leaked so badly that there was a towel stuffed under it to catch condensation but it was in vain as a huge puddle developed in the center of the hallway. There are plenty of other places in Key West to stay for comparable money. We recommend different accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: 071810b
Reviews.Content: I definetly think that some of the reviews posted were harsh. I actually found this hotel to be very nice. Upon check-in I was upgraded for free to a king bed suite. It was amazing! the room was the size of 2 hotel rooms and it had a balcany. The rooms was clean, there were a few big stains on the carpet, but the rug still felt clean. The towels and sheets were clean and didn't have any stains. There were a few ants around the sink in the kitchen area, but no sign of any infestation. The pool was clean and there was plently of seating. There continental breakfast needs some work, but it is listed as a "lite breakfast" There is wireless access in the lobby, and the staff was very helpful in booking some of the attractions. Yes there are roosters that crow early in the morning, but I they seemed to be all over Key West. I don't think its Days Inn's fault that the roosters are on their property. For $80 a night in key west you can't beat it! I would definetly say give this place a try if your visiting the key west area.

Reviews.Title: “Cock-a-doodle dont”
Reviews.Author: Billy_Scutts
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The rooms were filthy, lots of grime everywhere. The smoke alarm didn't work. There was paint coming off the wall and mould in some area's of the room. Half the tv channels had no sound, not that we were watching much tv but noted all the same. Light in bathroom came off the wall, wasn't really surprised as place is a dump. Carpet was filthy altogether, with stains everywhere albeit nasty ones at that. The inns clientÃ¨le consisted of half wits and hill billies, who sat around the pool all day drinking beer and eating tutsy rolls. The pools was nice, but an iguana urinated and left a large sample of excrement near the pools edge, that discouraged me from using the pool. needles to say it wasn't cleaned up by the pool staff. Much later some half wit tried removing the excrement using a leaf, yes a leaf who only made the situation worse by spreading all over the place. Breakfast = Type 2 diabetes, the fruit loops are definitely carcinogenic avoid. So we breakfasted in the waffle hut, but I am not reviewing it so I will not comment on how greasy the food is. And finally if you are staying pool side you will have an early morning call at 5.30 and subsequently every minutes there after, by the two cocks that live near the pool. Cock-a-doodle-do,why the days inn have two cocks and some hens on their motel I will never know.

Reviews.Title: “Cheapest Room Rate in Key West”
Reviews.Author: megamushroom
Reviews.Content: Hotwire Keywest and booked this hotel. So all in all is cheap. I paid 120 for the room. Room is OK, without any major problem. Spacious room, TV, Clean Bathroom. Small lobby to serve Free breakfast. Easily filled and they were also using the computer, not sure if there is wirelss LAN in the lobby, but no way in room. The only complain is this motel is far away from major attractions. You need to drive 20 minutes to the popular area and park for $4/hour in a parking lot. Otherwise, meter is a quarter for 10 minutes! unbelievable. If you drive there, you will easily missed Days Inn after you cross the last bridge.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad...”
Reviews.Author: divetravler
Reviews.Content: Check in was smooth and front desk staff were very friendly. The exterior of the hotel is showing it's age and looks a bit worn. The room was okay. Basic accomodations but clean and sufficient. Pretty far from town, parking is a pain and cabs are expensive. Not the best location if you are planning on spending a lot of time on Duval Street. I selected this property based upon price.

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: Mary626
Reviews.Content: It's what I paid for - a cheap hotel with a bed and shower. We didn't have any problems. Slept fine, everything was clean (bathroom fan was very loud - like a turbine engine, but not a big deal).. Cheapest place on the island we could find (I think we paid 130 a night). Location was great (but then again, the key is really small - not really any bad locations!). Would definitely stay here again if visiting key west. By the way, we booked on the hotel's website directly, which was thirty dollars cheaper than any of the hotel websites we looked at. As long as you don't mind that it's non-refundable, you might want to check out their website before you book.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room Great Rate!”
Reviews.Author: regasd
Reviews.Content: I had read many reviews on this motel before we left for our trip. It had a great rate on the internet so we chose to stay even with a few poor reviews. I found this motel to be very clean and employees to be very nice. Patty at the front desk was most helpful. Our room was spacious and well laid out. The pool area was clean and the water clear with plenty of towels available. My only complaint is that there was very little seating to eat the free breakfast. So we just took it to our room and ate there.I am a 17 year veteran motel manager and could find few faults with this motel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay if you want sleep”
Reviews.Author: buferino
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on the first night of my 12-day trip to Key West. I chose this property because it was my first trip to KW, didn't know anything, and thought, Well, it's only for one night, it's close to the airport... (and my other hotel didn't have availability). Now I know. I was unable to sleep, after traveling for 24 hours. The rooms facing the back parking lot are noisy, busy, and have a really creepy feeling with people walking past your windows continually throughout the night. Small groups congregated in the shadows of the back parking lot, doing who knows what. As soon as the nightcrawlers settled down, housekeeping started up. The place is really a dump, the TV reception is poor, the noise is incredible. If you are coming in from a long flight, if you're arriving after 9pm, if you are going to be in need of immediate food or rest, I would choose a property closer to town that is quieter. For $150 (or less!) there are SOOOOOOOO many more properties in Key West that are cleaner, quieter, cooler, more stylish, and friendlier. Though the front desk did provide me a takeout menu, they treated me like I was crazy for going out to part-ay on Duval right away. On checking out the next morning it took 25 minutes for them to call me a taxi - and there was no one else in the lobby. Read the other recent reviews and take these into consideration as well.

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: collazo333
Reviews.Content: Dump, who are they kidding with these reviews. Beds are old, if you like to wake up sore from bedsprings this is your hotel. I'll never use Priceline again, paid 250 a night for this 60 dollar hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice....”
Reviews.Author: imontheroadagain
Reviews.Content: This review is a mixed bag and I'll talk about the good, the bad and the ugly. Before going, I read the recent reviews so I was forwarned about concerns and problems people have experienced. We went to Key West, FL and booked this hotel because it was about the only thing affordable in our price range. Knowing what I do now, I would have stayed fewer days and paid more for something else. The Good: Probably the best thing is the pool scene. Also, generally you don't hear the neighboring room noise. The Bad: Ice machines that don't work, room safes that don't work, bad TV reception, poor quality/old construction that has seen better years and needs refurbished. The Ugly: Noise from cars and people walking by your room at all hours of the day and night. People carrying on at 2 a.m. like it's the middle of the day. When we arrived, I had already made it known that we wanted a quiet room away from the noise. David, the supervisor acknowledged our request and for some unknown reason put is in a room facing the parking lot (room 252). I should have known better but thought he knew the property better than me. What a mistake! It was near the maid's room (Grand Central Station) and was also at the the top of the stairs so everyone had to walk by at all hours of the day and night. We finally went to the office after night 3 (they were very nice and wondered why we were put in 252 to begin with) and moved us to room 239 which faces the courtyard and was 100% better. Still you have the drunks walking by at 2,3 and 4 a.m. carrying on like it was the middle of the day. That's not the hotels fault, mind you, but just a word to the wise... This hotel needs a serious makeover. I think if your only there a night or two and can't afford something better, well.... okay, at least you stayed in KW and got to enjoy the Mallory Square scene and other sights. Otherwise, shorten your stay and pay more for something better. Those $$ are probably well spent and will make your trip more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal and place experienced in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: mantisgirl
Reviews.Content: Located once you get on the island, easy to find, and far enough from the hustle and bustle crowd of Duvall street. Suites are large, super clean, private balcony, Waffle house on site. One full bathroom, but you can enter it from bedroom and another door from the living room. Price was excellent at total $150/night. Parking for boats and trailers available. Best place stayed in the keys so far. Would absolutely book again. It was very nice to head to the crowds and traffice and noise at Duvall street, but then be able to head "home" to less noise and people. Easy drive to beaches and to shopping on Key West. Finding parking at beaches (free) was easy and less than 3 miles away. Parking on/near Duvall Street was easy--just bring change. Hotel does not have a shuttle to take you downtown. A good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Mango stayed here on his Key West Florida Vacation...”
Reviews.Author: IslandFets
Reviews.Content: I loved the Days inn down in Key West, Patti at the front desk is nothing less than an angel..She made my day... Only gripe...No Internet Connections...NONE A real nice room at a real nice price....Mango will stay here again when performing in the Keys...

Reviews.Title: “not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: jetsetterda2007
Reviews.Content: i must say -i was extremely skeptical about staying at this hotel based on all the reviews i read but i must say it wasn't bad at all i actually thought it was above average. (and i have been to many around the world) At the end of the day who goes on vacation to stay in the room-if you are looking for a clean and affordable place to shower and sleep then this is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad; needs a little TLC in improving the room decor”
Reviews.Author: Cocopep
Reviews.Content: Decent accommodations. Room was fairly clean. The pool was very clear and the laundry facilities were good. Staff at the front desk were helpful and pleasant. The hotel housing staff were fast and accommodating. Based on the price, we probably would not have stayed here if we were not with a group. Not what one would expect for the great city of Key West, but overall, not too bad. Work on improving the room decor to brighten it up and this hotel may be one to consider in the future. A room refrigerator would also be great!

Reviews.Title: “worth 3x what they charge!”
Reviews.Author: CmV24
Reviews.Content: I was scared after reading the reviews posted here. Once I got to the hotel I saw an adverage hotel from the outside. The landscaping was nice and everything was clean. We got there and the staff was really nice and since they had a few different rooms in our catagory so they let us choose. The room was good size and again very clean.
