The view faced the ocean and the pool. Whenever we had the do not disturb sign up we were never bothered. The a few times when we woke up late and housekeeping was on the other side of the hotel, made one phone call and they brought us fresh towels etc. The ppl at the fron desk were very nice and gave us recomendations and directions at all hours of the day and night when we popped in. We lost both of our keys twice and were never chargeda cent for replacements. The pool has beautiful palm trees and flowers growing around it and we saw a couple baby iguanas n a few occasions. Over all it was very pleasent and worth 3x what we paid! We may not have been staying at the Hyatt but, they treated us like we were.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Catlady55
Reviews.Content: After booking this hotel on Hotwire, I checked out the reviews here and was really concerned about what to expect. Actually the hotel is very nice, quiet, clean, with fairly spacious room. However bathroom and vanity area were VERY small. Swimming pool was clean, heated, and very comfortable. They have a continental breakfast which consists of juices, coffee, and lots of packaged Sara Lee goodies. You have to drive to the downtown spots, but you are only about a mile and a half (an easy walk) from Smathers Beach which is the best beach in Key West. This is definitely not a luxury hotel, but for a two star hotel, I would give it a definite A rating.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good for a chain hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandieandangel
Reviews.Content: I was very surprised at how much I liked this hotel. I'm sure much of it has to do with the fact that I was upgraded to a Suite without asking. First I stayed there on the 16th of April thru the 18th. Then at the end of my vacation our reservation at the Navy Lodge ran out and I had to move. Originally I stayed at the Blue Lagoon to save money but that was a horrible experience and I decided the money was worth the Days Inn so I went back. This review is for both stays totaling 4 nights. The rooms were very clean and no bugs. The bed was soft comfy and had lots and lots of pillows. The kitchen was clean. The pool was nice enough but the breakfast was disappointing. While the coffee was great the rest was just packaged pastries. The walls must be very thick because not one time did I hear my neighbors. The property seemed pretty clean.The maids were very nice bringing me a vacuum both times I requested, very quickly. Overall, not too bad if you are just looking for a place to sleep and not spend too much time at.

Reviews.Title: “brought home cockroaches from this Days Inn”
Reviews.Author: magnolia23851
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend gave me this trip to Key West as a very special, romantic present, and the trip was wonderful; except for this hotel. We have written to the Day's Inn Main office concerning our stay and have heard nothing back from them - they probably have heard it so much that they don't care anymore; we have stayed at other Days Inn's across the country, but because of this lack of concern, we will NEVER stay at another Days Inn - ANYWHERE!! The staff was rude, our room wasn't even cleaned one day (and when we reported it, the front desk people were just plain hateful). There were potato chips sticking out from under the night stand (neither of us eat potato chips..), and cockroaches were our roommates! We didn't even mind that this hotel was as far from Duval Street as you can go on this island, we just wanted somewhere to rest our heads - but without cockroaches running across our faces. Upon arriving home, when I opened my suitcase, a cockroach ran out of it; then I had to call an exterminator. Save your money; sleep in the airport or under a box - trust me, it will be a better stay than you would have at this DUMP!!

Reviews.Title: “A good clean place”
Reviews.Author: Morfar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this hotel before going on the trip. We could not book in advance because we travelled by car from Atlanta, Ga. and how long would it take to drive? We showed up at the desk and had a nice room. The price was USD 159,99 + tax per night. We stayed at 11 motels and the only motel who rang to the room to hear if the room was OK - was Days Inn Key West. Thank You for that! That was a service to us!!! We did not like the breakfastmenu at the lobby or Waffle House, so we just went downtown! We stayed 2 nights and were completely satisfied! Would like to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: Trav56
Reviews.Content: Costing $300 w/tax, it wasn't worth $100. Toilet didn't flush ok, had to stand there holding the handle, lamp by bed didn't work, and the "breakfast" was a joke. Think, grocery store packaged breakfast treats. Had to spend good money after bad by having to go out to breakfast. Also, 4.5 miles from the action. Don't, I repeat, don't stay there unless it is the last room on the island. The "reservation" at $180 w/tax was not "in their computers" so had to pay the over the counter cost.

Reviews.Title: “OK if on a budget”
Reviews.Author: True_Briton
Reviews.Content: Key West in the winter is expensive in terms of accommodation costs. If you are looking to minimise your accommodation expense to free up some cash for some of the many great activities and dining Key West has to offer, then the Days Inn is worth a look. The hotel is very 'motel' style and is in a very busy location right at the T-junction between US 1 and Roosevelt. We were given a room that was in a 2nd floor 'tunnel' between blocks, so had zero view. The air con from neighbouring rooms reverberated outside. Having said this, it did not really matter as we were not in Key west to spend much time at the hotel, only to sleep, and as our own aircon was running in the night, any further noise was no bother. The room interior was perfectly clean, although a little dated. I would say the pool needed cleaning, so we did not use it. The included breakfast is essentially coffee plus prepackaged Danish, that's it. However, there is a Waffle House on-site and a Denny's in the Radisson which is walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Edmtourist
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I was nervous about our stay here. I had read about reservations being lost - so I confirmed our reservation 3 times before we went. Each time, our reservation was confirmed and we checked in with no problem. Rooms were very adequate for our stay. With the price savings at this hotel, we could afford to splurge on a great meal in Key West. You are away from the action of downtown Key West, but it is only a 5 to 10 minute drive to a parking garage within walking distance of the Conch Train Tour. Kids used the pool and were happy with it. The Waffle House is within the complex and is a great place for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing, convenient, economical, good deal”
Reviews.Author: chippsch
Reviews.Content: We had a great 3 day stay here. We didn't have a reservation but they accommodated us very nicely. I loved the pool area, just like being in the tropics! We had the 1 bedroom suite, very clean, everything worked, the resort overall is in good repair. I don't care about a breakfast, gift shop, etc. The Waffle House is good for me! If you are looking for luxury go somewhere and pay $300 and up, but if you want a good, clean hotel suite go here, you can't beat the price. By the way, we had no problems with desk clerks. The young man who waited on us was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Piacentini
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife spent just one night at this place, and it was enought to see that the quality is far from price. The bedroom had nice colors and nice space, but smelt like sweat, and i find an used sock under the linens (not mine). They donÂ´t serve any breakfast, and the sensation the place left on me was complete absence of security. An expensive hotel (US$ 120 a night) comparing the low quality of the place.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from the action”
Reviews.Author: Speukes
Reviews.Content: It was a big surprise when we got to our room. We had been given a big room, with a huge fridge (free) standing in a kind of a kitchen, and a big seperated bedroom with a second TV. We had to pay 66 euro to our travel agent for this hotel, so it was definitly worth the money. Location is not good, especially not if you don't have a (rental) car. You need it to get to the action. Breakfast is the worst we've ever had, couldn't be less in my eyes, but there's a waffle house at the spot.

HotelInfo.Name: Days Inn Key West
HotelInfo.Address: 3852 North Roosevelt Boulevard, Key West, FL 33040
